mini_game
Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
  mini_game.Sprite

public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object

Sprite objects represent a visible game entity, which may be a game character, enemy, or button. Sprites can register ActionListeners and thus test for and respond to mouse presses on them. Note that Sprite objects store data particular to single visible entity, and that multiple Sprites will share a single SpriteType, which refers to shared characteristics (like artwork) among those Sprites.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Richard McKenna

Constructor Detail

Sprite

public Sprite(SpriteType initSpriteType,
              float initX,
              float initY,
              float initVx,
              float initVy,
              java.lang.String initState)
Constructor for making a new Sprite with an initial position, velocity, state, etc. Note that a unique, accessible ID number is automatically assigned to each constructed Sprite.

Parameters:
initSpriteType - the SpriteType of this Sprite object, it dictates what artwork will be used for rendering it.
initX - initial X-axis position of this Sprite.
initY - initial Y-axis position of this Sprite.
initVx - initial X-axis velocity of this Sprite.
initVy - initial Y-axis velocity of this Sprite.
initState - initial state of this Sprite, which determines which of the possible images to use in rendering

the aabb's x value

getSpriteType

public SpriteType getSpriteType()
For accessing the SpriteType object. return the SpriteType of this sprite.

getX

public float getX()
For accessing the X-axis coordinate of this Sprite. return the x-axis location of this Sprite according to the top-left corner of the image used.

getY

public float getY()
For accessing the Y-axis coordinate of this Sprite.

Returns:
the y-axis location of this Sprite according to the top-left corner of the image used.

getVx

public float getVx()
For accessing the X-axis velocity of this Sprite. Note that velocity refers to pixels (game world units) moved each frame.

Returns:
the x-axis velocity of this Sprite.

getVy

public float getVy()
For accessing the Y-axis velocity of this Sprite. Note taht velocity refers to pixels (game world units) moved each frame.

Returns:
the y-axis velocity of this Sprite.

getState

public java.lang.String getState()
For accessing the current state of this Sprite. The state determines which image is used for rendering.

Returns:
the current Sprite state.

getID

public int getID()
For accessing the automatically generated ID number of this Sprite object.

Returns:
the ID number of this Sprite. Note that each Sprite has a unique id, which may or many not be used by the game application developer for things like event handling.

setActionListener

public void setActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener initListener)
Mutator method for specifying this Sprite's event handler for when the player clicks on it. Note addActionListener was deliberately used to avoid confusion, since each Sprite may only have one ActionListener param initListener the event handler to register for this sprite to be associated with mouse presses within its bounds.

setSpriteType

public void setSpriteType(SpriteType initSpriteType)
Mutator method for setting the type of Sprite this is.

Parameters:
initSpriteType - the SpriteType to use for rendering this sprite.

setX

public void setX(float initX)
Mutator method for setting the x-axis location of this Sprite.

Parameters:
initX - the x-axis location to move this Sprite to. Note that if a value less than 0 or greater than the game world width is provided the Sprite may no longer be visible, since it won't be in the game canvas.

setY

public void setY(float initY)
Mutator method for setting the y-axis location of this Sprite.

Parameters:
initY - the y-axis location to move this Sprite to. Note that if a value less than 0 or greater than the game world height is provided the Sprite may no longer be visible, since it won't be in the game canvas.

setVx

public void setVx(float initVx)
Mutator method for setting the x-axis velocity of this Sprite.

Parameters:
initVx - the x-axis velocity to be used. Note that this refers to the amount to move this Sprite each frame in the x-axis.

setVy

public void setVy(float initVy)
Mutator method for setting the y-axis velocity of this Sprite.

Parameters:
initVy - the y-axis velocity to be used. Note that this refers to the amount to move this Sprite each frame in the y-axis.

setState

public void setState(java.lang.String initState)
Mutator method for setting the state of this Sprite.

Parameters:
initState - the state to use for this Sprite, which will determine which image to use for rendering. Note that one should only set the state to one of the states made available by this Sprite's SpriteType. Using a different will result in error.

aabbsOverlap

public boolean aabbsOverlap(Sprite testSprite)
This method tests to see if the the testSprite's AABB overlaps this Sprite's AABB. true is returned if they overlap, false otherwise. return true if this Sprite's bounding box overlaps the testSprite's bounding box. false is returned otherwise.

calculateDistanceToSprite

public float calculateDistanceToSprite(Sprite targetSprite)
This method calculates and returns the real number distance from this sprite to the targetSprite using the top-left corner of their AABBs as points.

Parameters:
targetSprite - the Sprite to measure the distance to
Returns:
a scalar representing the direct distance from this Sprite's AABB to the targetSprite's AABB.

containsPoint

public boolean containsPoint(float pointX,
                             float pointY)
This method tests to see if the point represented by pointX, pointY is inside this Sprite's AABB. If it is, true is returned, otherwise false is.

Parameters:
pointX - - the x-axis coordinate of the test point
pointY - - the y-axis coordinate of the test point
Returns:
true if the point is inside this Sprite's AABB, false otherwise. Note that the AABB's borders are considered inside the box.

testForClick

public boolean testForClick(MiniGame game,
                            int x,
                            int y)
This method tests to if the x,y coordinates are inside this Sprite, and if they are, the registered event listener is invoked, making sure that a lock is first obtained on the data such that necessary updates may be made.

Parameters:
game - the game application being used.
x - the x-axis coordinate of the point being tested.
y - the y-axis coordinate of the point being tested.
Returns:
true if the point was inside the Sprite and an event handler is invoked in response. false otherwise, which means false will be returned if the point is inside the Sprite, but no event handler is registered for this Sprite.

update

public void update(MiniGame game)
Called once per frame, this method does a simple update for this sprite, moving its position according to its current velocity, making sure it doesn't leave the playing area. Note that this method should be overridden to provide custom AI or physics behaviour for a particular type of Sprite.

Parameters:
game -
